intro: Nerium antidysentericum, commonly known as the African oleander, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 6 meters tall, characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy clusters of pink or white flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is drought-tolerant, making it adaptable to various environmental conditions. Botanically, it belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes other toxic plants with similar morphological features.
